comments.author: frankbria
comments.text:
RESOLUTION: Fixed incorrect HTTP status code expectations in tests

Root Cause: Tests expected 403 (Forbidden) but auth middleware correctly returns 401 (Unauthorized)

HTTP Status Code Semantics:
- 401 Unauthorized = No authentication credentials provided (not authenticated)
- 403 Forbidden = Authenticated but lacks permission (authenticated but not authorized)

Tests Fixed (3):
1. test_book_cover_upload.py::test_upload_book_cover_unauthorized
2. test_export_endpoints.py::test_export_unauthorized
3. test_account_deletion.py::test_account_deletion_requires_authentication

Changes Made:
- tests/test_api/test_book_cover_upload.py:151
  Changed: assert response.status_code == 403
  To: assert response.status_code == 401

- tests/test_api/test_export_endpoints.py:201
  Changed: assert response.status_code == 403
  To: assert response.status_code == 401

- tests/test_api/test_routes/test_account_deletion.py:90
  Changed: assert response.status_code == 403
  To: assert response.status_code == 401

Result: All auth middleware tests now pass

comments.author: frankbria
comments.text:
RESOLUTION: Fixed user agent parsing for iOS/mobile device detection

Root Cause: Parser checked for "Mac" before "iOS/iPhone", causing iOS devices to be misidentified as MacOS since iPhone user agents contain "Mac OS X".

Issues Fixed:
1. OS Detection: iOS devices (iPhone/iPad) incorrectly identified as "MacOS"
2. Device Type: Truncated iPhone user agents without "Mobile" keyword not recognized as mobile

Tests Fixed (2):
1. test_extract_session_metadata_mobile
2. test_metadata_for_mobile_safari

Changes Made (app/services/session_service.py):

1. Device Type Detection (lines 45-51):
   Before:
   - Only checked for "mobile" and "tablet" keywords
   
   After:
   - Added checks for "iphone" and "ipad" as explicit mobile/tablet indicators
   - Store user_agent.lower() to avoid repeated calls

2. OS Detection (lines 64-75):
   Before:
   - Checked "Mac" before "iOS/iPhone" (line 67-68)
   - iOS check came last (line 73-74)
   
   After:
   - Check "iOS/iPhone/iPad" BEFORE "Mac" (line 70)
   - Added comment explaining why order matters
   - Reordered: Windows -> Android -> iOS -> Mac -> Linux

Result: All 15 session service tests now pass
